intro: Spergularia tenuis, commonly known as slender sandspurry, is a low-growing annual plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy flowers. The plant typically has hairy, fleshy leaves and produces small, pink or white flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Spergularia tenuis is adapted to arid conditions and is known for its ability to tolerate drought.
